channel.title: Java Bug System
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [JDK-8314164] java/net/HttpURLConnection/HttpURLConnectionExpectContinueTest.java fails intermittently in timeout
item.description:
STARTED HttpURLConnectionExpectContinueTest::testChunkedRequestAndNoExpect100ContinueResponse 'testChunkedRequestAndNoExpect100ContinueResponse()'
Aug 11, 2023 2:48:38 PM sun.net.www.protocol.http.HttpURLConnection plainConnect0
FINEST: ProxySelector Request for http://[0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1]:46617/
java.net.SocketTimeoutException: Connect timed out
at java.base/sun.nio.ch.NioSocketImpl.timedFinishConnect(NioSocketImpl.java:546)
at java.base/sun.nio.ch.NioSocketImpl.connect(NioSocketImpl.java:592)
at java.base/java.net.Socket.connect(Socket.java:751)

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
[jdk11u-fix-request] Approval Request from Anton Bobrov
This is required on top of backport of JDK-8054022 / https://github.com/openjdk/jdk11u-dev/pull/2523, the patch applies clean, testing: x86_64 build, affected test

A pull request was submitted for review.
URL: https://git.openjdk.org/jdk11u-dev/pull/2561
Date: 2024-02-27 09:58:14 +0000

This is required for backport of JDK-8054022 / https://github.com/openjdk/jdk11u-dev/pull/2523 so i'm trying to bring it back all the way to 11u-dev. The patch applies clean. Testing: x86_64 build, affected test.

This is required for backport of JDK-8054022 / https://github.com/openjdk/jdk11u-dev/pull/2523 so i'm trying to bring it back all the way to 11u-dev. The patch applies clean. Testing: x86_64 build, affected test.

A pull request was submitted for review.
URL: https://git.openjdk.org/jdk22u/pull/54
Date: 2024-02-16 14:59:48 +0000

Changeset: fbaaac63
Author: Darragh Clarke <dclarke@openjdk.org>
Date: 2024-01-23 14:07:17 +0000
URL: https://git.openjdk.org/jdk/commit/fbaaac63d4ae8d7cc0ec02ab4b5a934824d1fec1

A pull request was submitted for review.
URL: https://git.openjdk.org/jdk/pull/17535
Date: 2024-01-23 12:40:10 +0000

Previous failure spotted by Dan in in jdk-23+5-297-tier2 job set was:

STARTED HttpURLConnectionExpectContinueTest::testNonChunkedRequestAndNoExpect100ContinueResponse 'testNonChunkedRequestAndNoExpect100ContinueResponse()'
Jan 08, 2024 1:01:03 PM sun.net.www.protocol.http.HttpURLConnection plainConnect0
FINEST: ProxySelector Request for http://[0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1]:41373/
java.net.SocketTimeoutException: Connect timed out
at java.base/sun.nio.ch.NioSocketImpl.timedFinishConnect(NioSocketImpl.java:546)
at java.base/sun.nio.ch.NioSocketImpl.connect(NioSocketImpl.java:592)
at java.base/java.net.Socket.connect(Socket.java:752)
at java.base/sun.net.NetworkClient.doConnect(NetworkClient.java:178)
at java.base/sun.net.www.http.HttpClient.openServer(HttpClient.java:531)
at java.base/sun.net.www.http.HttpClient.openServer(HttpClient.java:636)
at java.base/sun.net.www.http.HttpClient.<init>(HttpClient.java:280)
at java.base/sun.net.www.http.HttpClient.New(HttpClient.java:386)
at java.base/sun.net.www.http.HttpClient.New(HttpClient.java:408)
at java.base/sun.net.www.protocol.http.HttpURLConnection.getNewHttpClient(HttpURLConnection.java:1310)
at java.base/sun.net.www.protocol.http.HttpURLConnection.plainConnect0(HttpURLConnection.java:1243)
at java.base/sun.net.www.protocol.http.HttpURLConnection.plainConnect(HttpURLConnection.java:1129)
at java.base/sun.net.www.protocol.http.HttpURLConnection.connect(HttpURLConnection.java:1058)
at java.base/sun.net.www.protocol.http.HttpURLConnection.getOutputStream0(HttpURLConnection.java:1460)
at java.base/sun.net.www.protocol.http.HttpURLConnection.getOutputStream(HttpURLConnection.java:1423)
at HttpURLConnectionExpectContinueTest.testNonChunkedRequestAndNoExpect100ContinueResponse(HttpURLConnectionExpectContinueTest.java:197)

So it seems that connection to the server can randomly fail in SocketTimeoutException.
We should investigate if we could change the test to reduce the chances of this happening.
I see that the test sets:
        connection.setConnectTimeout(1000);
Two things could be done:
  1. raise this timeout arbitrarily
  2. (maybe prefered?) Use jdk.test.lib.Utils.adjustTimeout to adjust the timeouts?

Finally - does the test logic requests to set a connection timeout in the first place? Or could we do without it without impairing what the test is testing?
